page.title: 06ST.ANDREWS CHURCH,LEASINGHAM
page.content: From evidence of carved stones the tower is part of the Norman church, that stood here in{Leasingham}in approximately 1175.It contains four bells.Their is a Norman doorway and on each side of the{belfry}are 13th century windows. The {spire }is a Broach spire of early English style. The{porch}is an{Angel porch,}because it has got an angel either side of it. The{Nave}has been rebuilt in the early English period,with the{North door}now blocked.The present{Chancel}was built in 1863. The{Piscina}is a small bowl set into a recess in the wall. The{Pulpit}is beautifully carved with leaves and twigs.It was built in 1871 of{Ancaster Stone.}The{13th {century font}has an octagonal base and stem with a copy of the original bowl added in the 15th or 16th century.
